results.title: Burma victory
results.creator_credit: David Macdonald, Army Film Unit and Roy Boulting
results.brief_description: Compilation of footage covering the Burma campaign against the Japanese between 1942 and 1945. For censorship reasons this campaign was given very little newsreel coverage and the footage was assembled into an absorbing narrative. Footage taken by British, Indian and American Combat Cameramen of South-East Asia Command.

results.title: Burma Railway
results.brief_description: A documentary covering the imprisonment of the ill-fated Australian 8th Division after the fall of Singapore in 1942, and the construction by the prisoners of war of the Burma Railway.

results.title: Burke and Wills
results.creator_credit: John Sexton, Graeme Clifford, Michael Thomas, Hoyts Edgley and Australian Film Investment Corporation
results.brief_description:
An epic journey from a turbulent chapter in Australia’s past, ‘Burke and Wills’ is the story of the explorers Burke and Wills’ expedition across the Australian continent in 1860. Jack Thompson is Robert O’Hara Burke, a strong Irishman obsessed with the desire to ‘write the map’; Nigel Havers is William John Wills, the archetypal Victorian gentleman explorer.

The film explores the changing relationship between the two men as they struggle with the harsh Australian environment they are attempting to chart.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Sexton, Graeme Clifford, Michael Thomas, Hoyts Edgley and Australian Film Investment Corporation

results.title: Burke and Wills
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
In 1860 Robert Burke and a party of explorers began the first overland crossing of Australia from Melbourne to the Gulf of Carpentaria. Both Burke and Wills perished on the way back. The film reconstructs the events that led to their deaths. This film is suitable for Years 7-12.

results.title: Burke's Backyard How to Create a Beaut Backyard
results.brief_description: Features selections from the best of “Burke’s Backyard” segments and looks at the basics of creating your own Shangrila. Designed for the whole family, the video takes the viewer through the tips and hints you need to know to create your own private paradise.

results.title: Buried treasure
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional, Coal Utilization Council and Donald Carter
results.brief_description: An account of the British coal industry covering: the geological formation of coal; the layout and ventilation of a modern mine; the work of individual coal miners; the organization of the various shifts throughout the day; methods employed to extract coal from the coal face; cleaning, grading and transport of coal at the pit-head. “Supervised by the Coal Utilization Council in association with John Grierson and Arthur Elton”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gaumont-British Instructional, Coal Utilization Council and Donald Carter

results.title: Buried treasure
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Johnson and friends”.
Johnson, the courageous pink elephant, leads his friends in 6 new stories. 1. “Baby of the family” Squeaky, the battered robot, was the baby of the toyroom, but also the strongest. How can the others protect her from dangerous games? 2. “The big freeze” It was the coldest day ever in Michael’s bedroom, so how will the toys get warm? 3. “Secrets” McDuff, the cheeky concertina, has a secret and all the other toys are desperate to know what it is. 4. “Operation Squeaky” Squeaky is broken and how will the other toys be able to fix her? 5. “Crying wolf” Diesel the dump truck is taught a lesson when he plays a nasty trick. 6. “Buried treasure” The toys set sail in search of buried treasure.

results.title: Buried country
results.creator_credit: Liz Watts, Film Australia, SBS Independent and Andy Nehl
results.brief_description: This documentary traces the history of Aboriginal country music over six decades, revealing how Aboriginal Australians have long been inspired by country music and have used it to tell their stories - of everyday life, the connection to the land, the fight for land rights and the struggle for equality. It combines rare archival images and recordings, interviews with musicians, including Jimmy Little, Harry and Wilga Williams, Bob Randall, Roger Knox, Bobby McLeod, Vic Simms, Auriel Andrew, Lionel Rose, Herbie Laughton, Galarrwuy Yunupingu and Troy Cassar-Daley, who speak about the challenges of performing, the discrimination they have faced and the support they have received. The film is both a celebration of the rich tradition of Aboriginal country music and a moving record of indigenous Australia. Based on the book of the same name by Clinton Walker. For further information about the film and related material visit http://buriedcountry.com

results.title: Buried cities
results.brief_description: Shows the excavations and reconstructions of the cities of Pompeii and Herculaneum. Gives an account of the eruption of Vesuvius in 79 AD and depicts life at the time.

results.title: Buried alive, the story of East Timor
results.creator_credit: Gil Scrine, Fabio Cavadini and Rod Hibberd
results.brief_description: In this film we see why the East Timor question is too important to go away. “The Story of East Timor” begins in a neglected corner of the Portuguese colonial empire. In Lisbon, the unexpected fall of the dictatorship projects the people of East Timor into world politics. It is to be a terrible experience. “Buried Alive” exposes some of the ugly truths about the nature of Western democracy, the world media and Third World Colonialism. Rated: PG
